intro: Microstegium biforme, commonly known as the two-lobed wood sorrel, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves with two distinct lobes. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by capsule fruits containing several seeds. Microstegium biforme typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It is a perennial herb that can spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
